page.title: 14Ancient Monuments-Pennington
page.content: Ellabarrow: In Pennington,by a stream,in a field there is a mound called Ellabarrow.Its shape is like an upturned boat with a point at each end.It is about 60 metres long,10 metres wide and 6 metres high.Legend says that a Saxon chieftan;Aela,is buried in it under his boat.It is said to be over 1000 years old.Pennington Castle; If you visited this you wouldn't think it was a castle because it has no stone walls.It is just a mound of earth built around two sides of a piece of earth shaped like a headland.We think it may have been built thousands of years ago by Bronze Age people.It is surrounded by steep edges and a stream runs down one side.At one time there may have been a wooden fence round the top and you can still see the remains of a ditch on two sides.
